metadata.title: CVE-2014-7945 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenJPEG before r2908, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before40.0.2214.91, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read) via a crafted PDF document, related to j2k.c, jp2.c,and t2.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
No subscription required

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120').
vxl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
